attributes.action: Have a unbiased count of the votes for the up and coming referendum on
attributes.background: as the people of the UK have no confidence in a fair and unbiased count of votes, we feel that a rigging of the in votes is most likely

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition in its current form as it does not call for a clear action from the UK Government and Parliament. Elections in the UK are overseen by the Electoral Commission which is independent of both Government and Parliament. Elections are run by independent Returning Officers (ROs) based in each local authority area.

You can find out more about the role the Electoral Commission plays in UK elections and referendums here: http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/our-work/roles-and-responsibilities/our-role-in-elections-and-referendums
